LOS 58.e
A forward rate agreement (FRA) is a derivative contract that has a future interest rate,
rather than an asset, as its underlying. FRAs are used by firms to hedge the risk of
borrowing and lending they intend to do in the future. A firm that intends to borrow
in the future can lock in an interest rate with a long position in an FRA. A firm that
intends to lend in the future can lock in an interest rate with a short position in an FRA.
